c74object.name: fl.frommax~
c74object.description:
In values mode the output is the last received value(s) as a vector. In params mode messages are collected and output as a single tagged frame. Typically params mode is used to help set object parameters. Output is triggered by frames arriving at the trigger input.
More info on conversion between Max messages and FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 4.

entry.name: /mode [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
[0] - values [1] - params
Sets the mode:
values - translate values from the host into vectors.
params - translate host messages into concatenated tagged frames.

objarg.name: mode
objarg.description:
This argument sets the mode parameter:
Sets the mode:
values - translate values from the host into vectors.
params - translate host messages into concatenated tagged frames.

method.name: int
method.digest: Value to convert to a vector frame
method.description: Performs the same function as list but with a single value.

method.name: float
method.digest: Value to convert to a vector frame
method.description: Performs the same function as list but with a single value.

method.name: list
method.digest: Values to convert to a vector frame
method.description:
If fl.frommax~ is set to values mode then incoming lists are stored as a vector. Whenever fl.frommax~ is scheduled the vector is output, until it is replaced by a new set of values.
If fl.frommax~ is in params mode then numerical inputs are ignored.

method.name: anything
method.digest: Tagged values to accumulate into a tagged output frame
method.description:
If fl.frommax~ is set to params mode then messages starting with a symbol will be accumulated into an internal tagged frame. When fl.frommax~ is next scheduled to output the tagged frame is output and the internal frame is reset to empty.
If fl.frommax~ is in values mode then messages starting with a symbol are ignored.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.frommax~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.frommax~. When set to 0 fl.frommax~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.frommax~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
